channel.title: Port forwarding help ill reward you!
channel.description: Hey Moparscape.org community, I am having major issues portforwarding 43594 as when i do using u torrent it says its open then i go to canyouseeme.org and it says 43594 is offline and i just cannot seem to get my head around this and its kinda annoying as i want to host my rs-ps also my firewall is not blocking it as i have added an expection and im using no-ip correctly and running my source although it just will not work. Please can someone get back to me ASAP! I will reward you with Rep+ or paypal 5 USD Please hurry and fix this issue i will thank you so much <3 Max.

i help people for free. and no problem, i tried my best. Never dealt with uTorrent Port forwarding, I don’t trust it, it’s basically hacking into your router.
Try updating your No-ip?

item.title: Port forwarding help ill reward you!
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

[quote=“maxw30, post:1, topic:414685”]Hey Moparscape.org community,
I am having major issues portforwarding 43594 as when i do using u torrent it says its open then i go to canyouseeme.org and it says 43594 is offline and i just cannot seem to get my head around this and its kinda annoying as i want to host my rs-ps also my firewall is not blocking it as i have added an expection and im using no-ip correctly and running my source although it just will not work. Please can someone get back to me ASAP! I will reward you with Rep+ or paypal 5 USD Please hurry and fix this issue i will thank you so much <3
Max.[/quote]
try portforwarding the old fashion way? http://192.168.1.1 - - Enter your router details and then portforward
More help can be found here (old fashioned way) http://www.portforward.com
Also if the 162.168.1.1 doesn’t work, try going to start and searching for ‘run’
Then type ‘cmd’ and when command prompt comes up, type
ipconfig
Find ‘Default Gateway’ and don’t close the cmd window, but remember the number
Now you go to that ip in your web browser. then right before you portforward, if your using the same computer as me, go to Start>Control Panel>Network and Internet>Network & Sharing center> to the left you should see
something that says “access type: internet Homegroup…” ect, click the last one which should be wireless network connection. Then click Proporties when a box pops up then find 'Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)
Highlight that then click proporties again. Then click 'use the following ip adress" and type in that default gateway in but change the last number to w/e you want but REMEMBER IT. click subnet mask, which should automatically fill in.
Example: My router: 192.168.1.1 my new ip for it: 192.168.1.9
Then put the default gateway into the default gateway spot, do not change this one. - Same with the dns server.
Press okay.
Then portforward using your NEW ip, this is the one you change just slightly.
Hope this helped XD Took awhile to type.

Read full topic
